features: Visual and audio feedback on button press
Mobile-first touch controls with large buttons
notes: DIFFERENT FROM CARD MEMORY: Sequential pattern recall instead of matching pairs
4 large colored buttons in 2x2 grid (red, blue, green, yellow)
Game shows pattern by lighting up buttons in sequence
Player must repeat pattern by tapping buttons in same order
Each successful round adds one more step to pattern
Audio feedback: different tone for each button (Web Audio API)
Visual feedback: button lights up brighter when active
Mobile controls: 4 large touch buttons (min 100px, fills screen width)
REQUIRED: touchstart + click listeners on all 4 game buttons
REQUIRED: preventDefault on touchstart to avoid double-firing
Display shows: current level, your turn/watch indicators
Game over on wrong button press, shows final score
CSS: Large buttons with clear visual states (normal, active, disabled)
Buttons positioned PROMINENTLY in center (this IS the game interface)
No separate mobile-controls div needed - buttons ARE the controls
Ensure complete HTML structure with no truncation
Complete JavaScript with full game loop and event handlers

userPrompt: Can you change the memory game to not be one based on cards? Something other kind of game since memorizing cards that flip is already in the arcade.

warnings.message: No dedicated .mobile-controls section found, but game uses touch-optimized buttons directly
AudioContext may require user interaction to resume on mobile browsers - consider adding audioCtx.resume() on first touch

docs.releaseNotes: yeah built you a Simon-style memory game with progressive difficulty and mobile touch controls - each round adds another step to the sequence, works smooth on phones with big colorful buttons and audio feedback
docs.howToPlay: Watch the sequence light up, then tap the buttons in the same order. Each round adds one more step. Miss the pattern and start over. See how long you can keep the streak going.
